{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3551402,"name":"Vinton ","username":"Vinton_Hester","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/vinton_hester/{size}/260424_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-08T21:08:15.021Z","cooked":"

Our school has a IT policy that prevents the pathplanner code file from being downloaded and prevents the code from building. I have had our other FRC team try to do it but to no avail.
What we have tried:
Disabling firewalls
Building from a local admin account
Hotspots
Running .\gradlew clean
I have tried it on my home computer which is a desktop and the code does build
Any help would be appreciated, we leave Wednesday for a regional.

The fail message is attached as well.

Screenshot 2025-03-08 1605521397×655 32.6 KB

It’s time to switch to someone’s personal laptop until such time as the school can allow pathplanner.

You’re welcome to try our mirror, we’re mirroring a number of libraries that get blocked including path planner, choreo, MapleSim…

    4. 
          
  4. 
          
  5. // Defining my dependencies. In this case, WPILib (+ friends), and vendor libraries.

  6. // Also defines JUnit 5.

    9.

    10.

    12.

    13. 
          
  13.     }
    14. 
          
  14. }
    15. 
          
  15.

    17. 
          
  17.     mainClass = "org.littletonrobotics.junction.ReplayWatch"
    18. 
          
  18.     classpath = sourceSets.main.runtimeClasspath
    19. 
          
  19. }
    20. 
          
  20. 
          
  21. dependencies {
    22.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2025-03-08T23:47:38.204Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":266,"readers_count":265,"score":53.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":494779,"topic_slug":"schools-it-blocked-pathplanner","display_username":"Max Morehead","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53784,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/schools-it-blocked-pathplanner/494779/12","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3551546,"name":"evanperryg","username":"evanperryg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/evanperryg/{size}/259696_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-09T00:39:39.957Z","cooked":"

These problems are all too common for FRC teams. I’m not even a programming mentor and I routinely have issues when the school’s IT department uses cannons to kill flies. Lately I’ve had issues with them blocking SSH. Yknow, those dang kids trying to access their ec2 instances during school hours.

The only solution is to own your infra. Don’t rely on school-issued computers, and don’t rely on their network. There are plenty of cheap used laptops that will do perfectly well as a driver’s station/programming machine. Pray you have a mentor and/or student with unlimited mobile data. It’s inconvenient and dumb, but that tends to be the story with school IT.

FYI, you should still be able to push changes over HTTPS. Github made it a lot more annoying requiring tokens as the password, but you can either manually create and use a personal access token, setup/use git credential manager which also comes set up by default on Git for Windows, or install the GitHub CLI which can setup authentication for you (and is what I personally use).
